title: What are the differences between IR theory and critical theory? - Quora

response.answer_text: IR Theory contains: InternationalismHuman Rights/EthicsRealism (aka Power politics)Critical TheorySecurity Studies/Security TheoryFeminist TheoryIn some sense the notion of critical realism is a bridge between realist theories and more critical theories. I believe it’s an acknowledgement by realists that some change is necessary. The critical theories (4 through 6), tend toward a constructivist model. These are mapped then in terms of economics and military policy, as well as other aspects of state-craft.

There is not just one IR theory. Some IR schools of theory include “realism”, “liberal internationalism”, “Marxism”, “Dependency Theory”, and “Critical Theory”. İn other words, “critical theory” is one of many theoretical approaches to the study of IR.
